TopicTitle: I am a teacher and am looking for help.

Articles.Content:
Hello everyone.

I am an ESL teacher here in Taiwan and I run a hi-tech STEM classroom for homeschoolers and low income families here. My students range from 6-14 years old and all of them are ESL learners with ranging English abilities.

I integrate Minecraft and Universal Sandbox into my English lesson plans and am just now getting ready to use KSP as well.

I love playing KSB! I just bought KSP and got instantly addicted. KSP has given me the inspiration to have a space program my students can run.

I then thought of an idea!

I am interested in introducing my students to more foreigners and I was wondering if anyone here would be interested in collaborating with me to help me present lesson plans for kids via SKYPE.

What I specifically need is a volunteer that will 'chat' with my students. The first class will probably be them asking where you are from and if you ever had Taiwanese food.

The classes will be very basic. For example, we will teach them how to build a basic rocket while teaching them words like 'rocket', 'fuel', 'flight', 'countdown', 'crash' and so on.

Like I said, it is pretty much a chatting session using KSP to 'sneak in' physics lesson. Do not worry, I will be right there the whole time if you get stuck.

Unfortunately, I cannot pay you. I do not run a charity or non-profit business. I do this simply because I do not like our current educational system. My classroom runs from money out of my own pocket, donations and fund raising events like our famous movie night and cupcake sales.

Keep in mind, we are GMT+8 and your class might be early in the morning or later in the evening for you depending where you live.

Requirements needed:

A copy of KSP

SKYPE Google Hangout

English as your first language

Good pronunciation

Patient

Friendly

You can make a difference in some of these kids lives.

Have a great day and I hope to hear from one of you.

Teacher Edward
